paragraphs.content: Chapter 23
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 23

paragraphs.content: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:
paragraphs.contentHtml: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:

paragraphs.content: And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.

paragraphs.content: Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat.

paragraphs.content: Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.

paragraphs.content: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.

paragraphs.content: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:

paragraphs.content: For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.

paragraphs.content: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.

paragraphs.content: Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.

paragraphs.content: Remove not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Remove not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:

paragraphs.content: For their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.

paragraphs.content: Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.

paragraphs.content: Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.

paragraphs.content: Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.

paragraphs.content: My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.

paragraphs.content: Yea, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.

paragraphs.content: Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the LORD all the day long.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the Lord all the day long.

paragraphs.content: For surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off.

paragraphs.content: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way.

paragraphs.content: Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:

paragraphs.content: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.

paragraphs.content: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

paragraphs.content: Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.

paragraphs.content: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.

paragraphs.content: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice.

paragraphs.content: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.

paragraphs.content: For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.

paragraphs.content: She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.

paragraphs.content: Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?

paragraphs.content: They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed wine.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed wine.

paragraphs.content: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.

paragraphs.content: At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.
paragraphs.contentHtml: At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.

paragraphs.content: Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things.

paragraphs.content: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.

paragraphs.content: They have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.
